searchHelp.title: Search help
searchHelp.help1: Enter term(s) for quickly searching through all main data tables. Uppercase and lowercase is not differentiated, for wildcard use asterisk
searchHelp.help2: In case of multiple terms the results will include any of the terms. To require a specific keyword to be present, precede it with '+'. To exclude a term, precede it with '-'. For instance:
searchHelp.help3: To search exact expression, use double quotation marks. Use them also if the term includes special characters like '+' or '-', for instance:

help4.prepend: Quick search box can also be used for more advanced queries, if you know names of database fields. For example, query by
help4.append: will search all records, where stratigraphy is set to Burtnieki Stage. NB! In this kind of search, uppercase is important ('asaphus' and 'Asaphus' are not the same) and * is useful.

prototype_alert.title: This is GeoCASe 2.0 prototype interface. It has incomplete functionality and data, and is intended for testing purposes only.
prototype_alert.text: This box will be replaced by brief introduction about GeoCASe.

fossils.title: Fossils
fossils.text: Fossils are remains or traces of once lived organisms. They include bones, shells, burrows, and occasionally mineralised soft bodies.

minerals.title: Minerals
minerals.text: Minerals have certain chemical composition and crystal structure. They are the basic building blocks of all rocks.

rocks.title: Rocks
rocks.text: Rocks and sediments make up solid Earth. They may be magmatic, sedimentary or metamorphic.

meteorites.title: Meteorites
meteorites.text: Meteorites are space rocks that have fallen on Earth. They are composed of the same minerals as earthly rocks.

footer.title: GeoCASe: The Earth Science Collections Portal
footer.collab_html: GeoCASe 2.0 is collaborative effort of the CETAF Earth Sciences Group.
footer.created_html: Portal software created and hosted by TalTech and MfN.
